examples: He admitted that he'd made an error.
The letter contains a number of typing errors.
Human error has been blamed for the air crash.
With something as delicate as brain surgery, there is little margin for error (= you must not make mistakes).
Not telling the staff before they read the news in the papers was an error of judgment.
The report described their refusal to send in ground troops as a serious error of judgment.
Senior police officers undoubtedly made errors of judgment as they struggled to contain unprecedented levels of violence.
Accepting the money was an error of judgment for which I have apologized unreservedly.
In later years, the prime minister admitted that he had made an error of judgment.

body_content.explanation: to understand that you were wrong to behave in a particular way and start to behave differently:
examples: I hope you can see the error of your ways - otherwise, there is no future for you in this business.
